text:
<@U06LHL57QLA> Notes are a separate object which are then associated with the respective object (Contact, Deal, Company etc..). You have to look into this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/notes>

Let me know if you are still blocked.

I am new to HubSpot CMS so I am creating my personal blog
Now I want people to subscribe to my blog using a newsletter with an input for First Name, an input for email address, and the submit. button and a script inside my newsletter so if a person enters the name and email address and then clicks submit it should send an alert in the browser but instead, I am getting this error 
```multi?domain=undefined&hs_preview_key=[SECRET]&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_file_path=simple-blog-theme%2Ftemplates%2Fhome.html&updated=1717260109483:333 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'addEventListener')
  at multi?domain=undefined&hs_preview_key=[SECRET]&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_file_path=simple-blog-theme%2Ftemplates%2Fhome.html&updated=1717260109483:333:42```
Here is the code
`<!--`
  `templateType: "section"`
  `label: "Multi-row content"`
  `isAvailableForNewContent: true`
`-->`


`{% dnd_section %}`

`{% dnd_module path='@HubSpot/rich_text' %}`
          `{% module_attribute "html" %}`
`<div class="newsletter ">`
    `<div class="container px-5 w-75">`
        `<div class="row py-5">`
            `<div class="col-12 col-md-6">`
                `<h3>:love_letter: Subscribe to my newsletter</h3>`
                `<h5 class=" fs-6">Subscribe to my newsletter, with thoughts on life, identity, making things and more.</h5>`
            `</div>`
            `<div class="col-12 col-md-6 d-flex justify-content-md-end align-items-start">`
                `<div class="w-100 w-md-auto">`
                    `<input type="text" class="form-control mb-3 py-2" placeholder="First Name">`
                    `<input type="text" class="form-control mb-3 py-2" placeholder="Email address">`
                    `<button class="btn btn-primary w-100 py-3">Subscribe</button>`
                `</div>`
            `</div>`
        `</div>`
    `</div>`
`</div>`
`<script>`
    `document.getElementById('newsletterForm').addEventListener('submit', function(event) {`
        `event.preventDefault();`
        `var formData = new FormData(event.target);`
        `var jsonData = {};`
        `formData.forEach((value, key) => {`
            `jsonData[key] = value;`
        `});`

        `fetch('[SECRET]]', {`
            `method: 'POST',`
            `headers: {`
                `'Content-Type': 'application/json'`
            `},`
            `body: JSON.stringify(jsonData)`
        `})`
        `.then(response => response.json())`
        `.then(data => {`
            `alert('Subscription successful!');`
            `event.target.reset();`
        `})`
        `.catch(error => {`
            `console.error('Error:', error);`
            `alert('Subscription failed. Please try again.');`
        `});`
    `});`
`</script>`
`{% end_module_attribute %}`
`{% end_dnd_module %}`
`{% end_dnd_section %}`
Can anyone @here @channel help me to fix the issue whereby I am encountering an issue with my JavaScript code when I am trying to capture form submissions on my blog newsletter signup form in HubSpot CMS?

Hi, <@U06KP87QUJW>
Thank you for your reply.
Yes, it worked successfully and I got the notes from HubSpot through api, but I didnt find the association fields, so I didnt get the association info for the notes.
I would appreciate it if you could help me with this. :pray:
I look forward to your response.
I have attached the api request and the error message.

Hi All
I am writing a code to get all the deals from the HubSpot account but am not able to understand the API - can someone help me through this

I want my data to be just like when I export the data directly from the website

<@U06LHL57QLA> if you want to fetch notes of a particular contact you should use the associations endpoint as per my screenshot - which is in line with the READ request in documentation here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>.

Then after fetching the note IDs related to that contact, you can use the batch read to fetch all the notes by IDs in one request as explained here <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/notes>

I would start by checking the documentation <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>  - Then you should consider taking a course to help you - <https://academy.HubSpot.com/> - Integrating With HubSpot I: Foundations would be a good starting point for learning about working with the APIs

<@U06KP87QUJW>
I saw there is a association field for list api of notes.
I want to use this so that I can get the association typeId and association objectId.
Could you please help me with this?
Ok thanks. I will stay tuned to the developer change log, but if you see an opportunity for me to test this ASAP, please let me know.

Good morning, I hope everyone is well!
I have a question, I am integrating with HubSpot and I need to use the pageView track for a flow in HubSpot, I managed to make the pageViews tracked but I was unable to relate them to created contacts, I believe it is necessary to pass some additional parameter in the contact creation but I didn't find anything in the documentation.
Could anyone help me with this?

Hello,
Do you know how de set up Facebook API Conversion when i use HubSpot for marketing ?
Does HubSpot set up via conversion API alone or do i need to set up something ?
If someone can help be, it will be more than helpfull :slightly_smiling_face:

Thanks,

Hi, put this into a loop <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals?limit=1&archived=false>

Add the Private App Token as "Bearer" and you are good to go. You might need to add additional properties, since default is very limited.

Hi All, I have tried to integrate HubSpot with Azure Data Factory. Access and Refresh Tokens conversion API is not working (yes it is the V1 from the Documentation). No matter what I have tried (App in developers account, proper grant_type and additional parameters, App code from domain all provided as followed the docs). 405 Method Not allowed. (I assume V1 is phased out). How can I get these token for ADF with V3 APIs or better yet how to connect ADF with HubSpot without these? Thanks

Question 2. I have used the V3 Events API, but for whatever reason the
1. objectType parameter is not working at all
2. When I pull data with eventType for social stats then I only get YouTube data and nothing else. 
Can anyone help?

Question 3. When I do a paging loop for V3 API the very last record is missing from any data pull, because the "paging:" with blank link is not listed on the last record. Is there any way to add that so the loop would work? Thx.

Hi, <@U06KP87QUJW>
I would appreciate it if you could help me when you have a moment. :pray:
<@U06LHL57QLA> association category I believe is HubSpot_DEFINED and the ID can be found at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>  as per my screenshots

Thank you for all your help, <@U06KP87QUJW>
I will try it and will ask you if I have any further questions, okay?
Anyone knows the max amount of records that can be created for <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/new-public-apis-for-orders-and-carts-objects|carts and orders>?

Hi, everyone.
It's my first time using HubSpot API and i'm new in the programming area. I'm making a request at this url '<https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/events>', but, I'm bit confused concerning the meaning of the fields. Can someone tell me where I can find what which field means?

I'm new to HubSpot as well, but is this what you're looking for?

That's exactly what I needed. Thanks bro!!!

Thanks Scott.

Pretty sure it‚Äôs a Private App. It‚Äôs in the Private App section of the portal, created from there, and I know for a fact that when I downgraded the user‚Äôs permissions, the scope of the app got affected.


This article also confirms that the scope is tied to user‚Äôs permissions:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps>

‚ÄúPlease note: private apps will lose access to scopes when your HubSpot account is downgraded and loses access to functionality. For example, if your account does not have access to HubDB, your private app will not have access to the HubDB scope.

Private app access tokens will be updated to reflect available scopes in your HubSpot account and what you configured for the private app, but the token string itself will not change.‚Äù

That‚Äôs why I wanted to see if it could be transferred to another user but at that point creating a new private app seems like less work.
